messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Re: Backyard question
messages.msgSnippet: If your landlord won t let you paint the fence you could make a large mural on a canvas tarp and then seal it up with poly and hang it on the fence. :) Jane
messages.messageBody:
If your landlord won't let you paint the fence you could make a large mural
on a canvas tarp and then seal it up with poly and hang it on the fence. :)
Jane

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Re: Backyard question
messages.msgSnippet: I want to thank everyone for all the great ideas! Our landlord is comeing by today and I m going to find out what all I can do in the backyard. I love the idea
messages.messageBody:
I want to thank everyone for all the great ideas! Our landlord is comeing by today and I'm going to find out what all I can do in the backyard. I love the idea of painting a mural on the back fence, my brother's an artist and said he'd love to do something on it for us.

Thanx again! I have been inspired!

~Rebecca

messages.subject: Re: Backyard question
messages.msgSnippet: ***a  high wooden fence on the back*** Look at garage sales for different colors of exterior latex and paint a mural on the fence.  It could be dinosaurs or a
messages.messageBody:
***a high wooden fence on the back***

Look at garage sales for different colors of exterior latex and paint a
mural on the fence. It could be dinosaurs or a spaceship invasion or
jungle animals or racing cars or a Marc Chagall scene or anything.

You can buy paint for concrete and paint a habitat or a roadway for Hot
Wheels or a twister mat or something on the concrete, if it's a wide flat
surface...I'm not picturing the yard well... sorry if that's a goofy
idea.

Deb L
